means: 以沙砾覆盖（某物），撒沙砾于

sentence.Network_en: You'll never quite get rid of every last bit of grit.
sentence.Network_cn: 无法把所有的沙砾都清除干净。

sentence.Network_en: I pretended to rub a fleck of grit from one eye.
sentence.Network_cn: 我假装拭去一只眼睛里的沙粒。

sentence.Network_en: He felt tiny bits of grit and sand peppering his knees.
sentence.Network_cn: 他感到细小的沙砾不断打在膝盖上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grēot 'sand, gravel', of Germanic origin; related to German Griess, also to groats

entry.def: Grit is very small pieces of stone. It is often put on roads in winter to make them less slippery.

example.ex: He felt tiny bits of grit and sand peppering his knees.
example.tran: 他感到细小的沙砾不断打在膝盖上。

entry.def: If someone has grit, they have the determination and courage to continue doing something even though it is very difficult.

example.ex: You've got to admire her grit.
example.tran: 你不得不佩服她的勇气。

entry.tran: 粗玉米粉，玉米渣（美国南部常食用）
entry.def: Grits are coarsely ground grains of corn which are cooked and eaten for breakfast or as part of a meal in the southern United States.

entry.tran: （通常指因愤怒而）咬紧牙关，咬牙切齿
entry.def: If you grit your teeth, you press your upper and lower teeth tightly together, usually because you are angry about something.

example.ex: Gritting my teeth, I did my best to stifle one or two remarks...
example.tran: 我咬紧牙关，硬是吞回了几句话。

example.ex: 'It is clear that my client has been less than frank with me,' said his lawyer, through gritted teeth.
example.tran: “我的当事人显然没有告诉我实情，”他的律师咬牙切齿地说道。

entry.def: If you grit your teeth, you make up your mind to carry on even if the situation is very difficult.

example.ex: There is going to be hardship, but we have to grit our teeth and get on with it.
example.tran: 未来会很艰难，但是我们必须咬牙坚持下去。

sentences.sentence: "he didn't have the guts to try it"

auth_sentence.content: The grit and rawness of the label shines through.
auth_sentence.res_content: The grit and rawness of the label shines through.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The grit and rawness of the label shines through.

auth_sentence.content: You need enough salt to give the mixture some grit.
auth_sentence.res_content: You need enough salt to give the mixture some grit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You need enough salt to give the mixture some grit.

auth_sentence.content: The grit of sand was underfoot and on every surface.
auth_sentence.res_content: The grit of sand was underfoot and on every surface.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The grit of sand was underfoot and on every surface.

sentences.en: I’ve got some〔a piece of〕 grit in my shoe.
sentences.cn: 我的鞋里进了些〔一粒〕 沙子。

sentences.en: Mountaineering in a blizzard needs a lot of grit.
sentences.cn: 在暴风雪中登山需要极大的勇气和毅力。

sentences.en: The young policeman gritted his teeth and walked slowly towards the armed criminal.
sentences.cn: 年轻警官强忍住怒火,朝武装歹徒慢慢走过去。

sentences.en: When I was a boy, I was forced to have a cold shower every morning. I hated it but I just had to grit my teeth and do it.
sentences.cn: 小时候，我被迫每天早上洗冷水澡，我很不情愿但仍然咬紧牙关坚持了下来。

sentences.en: She shouted at me but I just gritted my teeth and said nothing.
sentences.cn: 她对我大叫大嚷，而我只是咬紧牙关忍着什么也没说。
